yaml.title: About
yaml.subtitle: Assistant Professor (tenure track) in Lifespan Developmental Psychology (adult development with a focus on technology and/ or digitalization) at University of Luxembourg.

markdown.markdown:
<!-- Google tag (gtag.js) -->
<script async src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-VLRYTQT397"></script>
<script>

  function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}

</script>


:::{#hero-heading}


Ageing, culture, and digital technology. Particular focus on ageing migrants.

## Bio

Since July 2025, Head of institute Lifespan Development, Family and Culture. University of Luxembourg.

Member in the ALLBUS team ([German General Social Survey](https://www.gesis.org/en/allbus)) at GESIS - Leibniz Institute for the Social Sciences in Mannheim, Germany. Here, I acquired invaluable expertise into managing large scale surveys in addition to developing an interest in programming for the social sciences using _R_. My direct supervisor was [Oshrat Hochman, PhD](https://www.gesis.org/en/institute/about-us/staff/person/Oshrat.Hochman). 

At the University of Vechta in Germany, I developed my research agenda on migration and ageing. [Prof. Dr. Maria Pavlova](https://www.uni-vechta.de/gerontologie/personen/prof-dr-maria-pavlova) was my direct employer. 

My PhD studies were at Bremen International School of Social Sciences ([BIGSSS](https://www.bigsss-bremen.de/)). The doctoral title was conferred by University of Bremen and Jacobs University Bremen (now Constructor University Bremen).

I studied Sociology at the Bachelor level in Bucharest, Romania. I hold a Master's degree in Social Psychology from University of Groningen, the Netherlands.

I speak Romanian, English and German fluently.

I practice Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu since 2021.

I am a stroke survivor.

## Contact

**Email**: adrian.stanciu[at]uni.lu

**Note**: I will not consider nor respond to unsolicited work inquiries, traineeship and any form of collaboration that involves financial efforts on my part or the institution I represent. For all such collaborations, only applications and requests via the official channels will be considered.

:::
